trans-unit.source: Defines a segment of time over which output values are produced.
These values are used to animate a target property.
An <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline> is a type of <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline> object that generates output values based on its timing progress.
All animation types inherit from <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline>.

**Freezable Features:** Because it inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> class, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline> class provides several special features: <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline> objects can be declared as , shared among multiple objects, made read-only to improve performance, cloned, and made thread-safe.

For more information about the different features provided by <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects, see the [Freezable Objects Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/freezable-objects-overview.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline"></xref> class.
Creates a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock"></xref> for this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline"></xref>.
This method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.CreateClock%2A> method and should not be called directly by your code.
A clock for this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline"></xref>.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true.`
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock"></xref> from this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline"></xref>.
This method shadows the inherited <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.CreateClock%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method with a type-safe implementation.
A new clock, created from this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline"></xref>.
Gets the current value of the animation.
The origin value provided to the animation if the animation does not have its own start value.
If this animation is the first in a composition chain it will be the base value of the property being animated; otherwise it will be the value returned by the previous animation in the chain.
The destination value provided to the animation if the animation does not have its own destination value.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock"></xref> which can generate the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentTime"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentProgress"></xref> value to be used by the animation to generate its output value.
The value this animation believes should be the current value for the property.
Returns the length of a single iteration of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline"></xref>.
This method provides the implementation for <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.GetNaturalDuration%2A> and should not be called directly from your code.
The clock that was created for this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline"></xref>.
The animation's natural duration.
This method always returns a <xref href="System.Windows.Duration"></xref> of 1 second.
Identifies the IsAdditive dependency property.
Identifies the IsCumulative dependency property.

Gets a value that indicates whether this animation uses the *defaultDestinationValue* parameter of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline.GetCurrentValue(System.Object,System.Object,System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock)"></xref> method as its destination value.

**true** if the *defaultDesintationValue* parameter of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline.GetCurrentValue(System.Object,System.Object,System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock)"></xref> method is the value of this animation when reaches the end of its simple duration (its clock has a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentProgress"></xref> of 1); otherwise, **false**.
The default implementation always returns **false**.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of property that can be animated.
The type of property that can be animated by this animation.
